ราคา Dogecoin ดิ่งลง 11%: อะไรต่อไปเมื่อเงินมูลค่า 1 พันล้านดอลลาร์ไหลออกจาก DOGE?

Dogecoin price slips 11%: What’s next as $1B exits DOGE?

11h ago//Gladys Makena
altcoins
AI

Summary

TH

Dogecoin (DOGE) เผชิญกับแรงกดดันขาลงอย่างหนัก โดยราคาดิ่งลงมากกว่า 11% ทะลุแนวรับที่สำคัญที่ระดับ $0.1 จนถึงระดับประมาณ $0.09064 การดิ่งลงครั้งนี้ทำให้มูลค่าตามราคาตลาด (Market Cap) ระเหิดไปมากกว่า 1 พันล้านดอลลาร์ ข้อมูลตลาด Spot ชี้ให้เห็นว่าผู้ขายมีอำนาจเหนือกว่าอย่างชัดเจน และราคาได้แตะระดับต่ำสุดตั้งแต่เดือนสิงหาคม 2024 ที่ $0.08 ก่อนจะมีการดีดตัวกลับเล็กน้อย ตัวชี้วัดทางเทคนิคและข้อมูลจากตลาด Futures ยืนยันแนวโน้มขาลง โดยนักเทรดกำลังปิดสถานะและลดความเสี่ยง (Deleveraging) อย่างมาก Open Interest ลดลง 16.7% พร้อมกับการไหลออกของเงินทุนในตลาด Futures สะท้อนถึงความระมัดระวังของนักลงทุน นอกจากนี้ Stochastic RSI ยังได้ลงไปอยู่ในโซนขาลงลึก และราคาซื้อขายอยู่ต่ำกว่าค่าเฉลี่ยเคลื่อนที่ (EMA) สำคัญ ซึ่งบ่งชี้ว่าผู้ขายครองบังลังก์อยู่ในตอนนี้ ในมุมมองข้างหน้า หากแรงขายยังคงดำเนินต่อไป DOGE มีความเสี่ยงที่จะร่วงลงไปทดสอบแนวรับ $0.08 อีกครั้ง อย่างไรก็ตาม การกลับตัวฟื้นตัวยังเป็นไปได้หากผู้ซื้อกลับเข้ามาแรงพอที่จะทะลุ EMA20 ที่ระดับ $0.11 ซึ่งอาจเป็นสัญญาณเริ่มต้นการปรับตัวขึ้นสู่ระดับ $0.12 จนกว่าจะถึงเวลานั้น ทิศทางตลาดยังคงอ่อนแอและมีความเสี่ยงสูง

EN

Dogecoin faced significant downward pressure, slipping over 11% and falling below the critical $0.1 support level to trade around $0.09064. This decline resulted in the memecoin's market cap shedding more than $1 billion, as spot market data indicated strong seller dominance with a negative buy-sell delta. The drop brought DOGE near its August 2024 lows of $0.08 before a minor rebound, reflecting a broad market shift toward bearish sentiment. Technical indicators and futures market data reinforce the bearish trend, with traders aggressively deleveraging and closing positions. Open Interest dropped by 16.7% to $986.39 million, and Dogecoin recorded substantial futures outflows, reflecting widespread risk-off behavior. Additionally, the Stochastic RSI has plummeted deep into the bearish zone, and the price is trading below key moving averages, suggesting sellers currently have total control. Looking ahead, if selling pressure persists, DOGE risks revisiting the $0.08 support level. However, a trend reversal remains possible if bulls can muster enough buying pressure to reclaim the EMA20 at $0.11, which could pave the way for a rally towards $0.12. Until then, the market outlook remains weak and precarious as investor confidence wanes.

Key Points

  • DOGE price dropped over 11%, falling below the $0.1 support level to a low of $0.08.
  • Market cap decreased by more than $1 billion with spot market showing heavy selling volume.
  • Futures Open Interest declined 16.7% as traders aggressively closed positions and derisked.
  • Technical indicators like Stochastic RSI signal strong bearish momentum with sellers in control.
  • Key support is at $0.08, while bulls need to reclaim the EMA20 at $0.11 for a trend reversal.

Article

Journalist Posted: February 7, 2026 Dogecoin [DOGE] extended its slip below $0.1, its critical support zone. The memecoin breached $0.09 and dipped to August 2024 lows around $0.08 before rebounding to $0.093. At press time, DOGE traded at $0.09064, down 11.4% on the daily charts. Over the same period, the memecoin market cap fell by more than $1 billion, reflecting substantial outflows. Dogecoin faces bearishness DOGE exhibited stubborn weakness as the market shifted entirely bearish, and traders aggressively liquidated their positions. On the spot side, for example, the market exhibited total seller dominance. According to Coinalyze data, the memecoin recorded 3.1 billion in Sell Volume between the 5th and 6th of February. Over the same period, the memecoin recorded 2.6 billion in Buy Volume, leaving the market with a negative delta of 400 million. Source: Coinalyze Often, a negative buy-sell delta suggests that sellers have the upper hand in the market and that their attempts have been futile. A sustained period of increased selling activity intensifies downward pressure, often a prelude to lower prices, as recently observed. On the futures side, traders aggressively closed their positions as they derisked and deleveraged. CoinGlass data showed that Dogecoin recorded $2.22 billion in Futures outflows compared to $2.18 billion in inflows. Source: CoinGlass At press time, the memecoin’s Futures Netflow stood at -$39 million, improving from the previously recorded -$88 million. This increase in outflows indicates that many futures market participants closed their positions, either to limit losses or secure profits. In fact, Open Interest declined 16.7% to $986.39 million, reflecting reduced market leverage, a clear bearish signal. Can DOGE bulls reclaim $0.1? Dogecoin strengthened its position below $0.1, as every market participant turned bearish and aggressively closed their positions. As a result, the downward momentum strengthened, as evidenced by the Stochastic RSI. This momentum indicator fell further into the bearish zone, hitting 13 .70 as of writing. A momentum indicator at such low levels suggested intense downward pressure, with sellers exerting total control over the market. Source: TradingView At the same time, the memecoin traded below its short- and long-term Moving Averages (EMAs), further confirming downward momentum. These market conditions leave DOGE in a weakened position, risking further price losses. Thus, if sellers continue to offload, DOGE will likely drop towards $0.08 again. For a meaningful trend reversal, bulls must increase buying pressure and reclaim the EMA20 at $0.11, setting the stage for a move towards $0.12. Final Thoughts DOGE continued its bearish streak, breached $0.09 slevel and fell to August 2024 lows of $0.08 Dogecoin weakness persisted as investors across the market aggressively closed positions.
